block.p: Geraldine Patricia Hugo, a documentary film writer and producer, and Edward Lloyd Mohr, an investment banker, were married yesterday by the Rev. Boniface Ramsey, a Roman Catholic priest, at the Church of St. Vincent Ferrer in New York.

Ms. Hugo, 36, who is keeping her name, wrote and produced episodes for the ''Biography'' series on A&E, the cable television channel. A biography she wrote and produced about Diana, the Princess of Wales, was shown on MSNBC this month.

Geraldine Patricia Hugo, a documentary film writer and producer, and Edward Lloyd Mohr, an investment banker, were married yesterday by the Rev. Boniface Ramsey, a Roman Catholic priest, at the Church of St. Vincent Ferrer in New York.

Ms. Hugo, 36, who is keeping her name, wrote and produced episodes for the ''Biography'' series on A&E, the cable television channel. A biography she wrote and produced about Diana, the Princess of Wales, was shown on MSNBC this month.

The bride graduated from Williams College and received a master's degree from the Columbia Graduate School of Journalism. She is a daughter of Geraldine Hugo and Dr. Norman E. Hugo of New Canaan, Conn. Her father retired as the chief of plastic surgery at the Columbia-Presbyterian Medical Center in New York. He is a professor emeritus of surgery at the Columbia College of Physicians and Surgeons.

Mr. Mohr, 36, is an associate director in New York with UBS Warburg, the investment bank. A graduate of Amherst College, he received a master's degree in international relations from Johns Hopkins and an M.B.A. from the University of Chicago. His parents, Elizabeth and William David Mohr, live in Benton Harbor, Mich., where his father owns Instracon, an electronics consulting and service company.
